archives.justification: Ignore everything not included in the module itself

exclude.justification: The implementation package is not meant to be used directly, and as such does not need to maintain any backwards compatibility guarantees.
The fetch commands were flagged as experimental, and as such does not need to maintain any backwards compatibility guarantees.
The search commands were flagged as experimental and as such does not need to maintain any backwards compatibility guarantees.
The rest protocol classes/methods are only internal and are not user-facing, and as such does not need to maintain any backwards compatibility guarantees.

differences.justification: Ignore new methods on all types, as these are not meant to be implemented but simply consumed; as such, new methods are perfectly fine to add
The ExperimentalApi annotation is used to mark methods as 'in-development'. It is okay to remove it after a feature is implemented
The ExperimentalApi annotation is used to mark methods as 'in-development'. It is okay to change value field
The ExperimentalApi annotation is used to mark methods as 'in-development'. It is okay to remove the methods.
